title: Fix P1: Use text fs-root or send JSON-compatible updates (PR #4)
description: From PR #4 Codex review: The fs-root node is created with content_type application/json but the updates being sent may not be JSON-compatible.
design: Resolved by CP-qmk (PR #9). The push_schema_to_server function now uses create_yjs_map_diff_update which generates Y.Map updates instead of Y.Text updates. This makes the updates JSON-compatible as required by the fs-root node's application/json content type.
close_reason: Resolved by CP-qmk fix - client now applies server CRDT state before making changes, ensuring proper tombstone creation for deletions. Merged in PR #9.

title: Implement Router Documents (docs/ROUTER.md)
description:
Implement the router document feature as specified in docs/ROUTER.md:

- Add `--router <node-id>` CLI flag (repeatable)
- Router documents are JSON with `version`, `nodes`, and `edges` 
- Server subscribes to router document blue port for changes
- Apply/diff wiring based on router document content
- Emit `router.error` events on red port for errors
- Handle node creation hints from `nodes` section
- Track router-created wires separately from other wires
design:
Implementation approach:

1. New module: src/router/ with:
   - mod.rs: Module exports
   - error.rs: RouterError enum for parse/validation/cycle errors
   - schema.rs: RouterSchema, Edge, NodeSpec, PortType structs with serde
   - manager.rs: RouterManager that subscribes to router document's blue port

2. CLI: Added --router <node-id> flag (repeatable) in cli.rs

3. RouterConfig: Added routers: Vec<String> field

4. Initialization: In lib.rs, for each router ID:
   - Get or create JSON document node
   - Create RouterManager with registry reference
   - Start background watcher task
   - Perform initial wiring

5. Wire management:
   - RouterManager tracks wires it created (WireKey -> SubscriptionId)
   - On each reconcile, diffs desired vs current wires
   - Removes wires no longer declared, adds new ones
   - Cycle detection handled by registry, emits router.error on failure

6. Error handling:
   - Parse errors, unsupported version, missing nodes, cycles → router.error event on red port
close_reason: Router documents feature implemented. Added --router CLI flag, RouterManager, schema validation, wiring management, and error events. Addressed 4 P2 review suggestions. Merged in PR #8.

title: Fix P2: Skip wiring when an identical edge already exists (PR #8)
description: From PR #8 Codex review: The router creates wires based on managed_wires, but if a wiring already exists from an external source (e.g., /nodes/:from/wire/:to), this code will still call wire_* and create a second subscription. Consider checking existing registry wirings before adding.
design: Added `find_existing_wiring(from, to, port)` method to NodeRegistry. Router manager now checks for existing wires before creating new ones and adopts them into managed_wires if found. Known limitation: Adopted wires skip the router's cycle error emission, but this is safe because external wire creation already performs cycle detection at the registry level.
close_reason: Skip duplicate wirings implemented. Added find_existing_wiring() to NodeRegistry. Router now checks for existing wires before creating new ones and skips duplicates without claiming ownership (prevents router interference). Merged in PR #10.

title: Fix server replay to use node's content type for JSON documents
description:
P1 from PR #6 review: The server's /nodes/:id/head and replace endpoints replay with ContentType::Text, but Y.Map commits need ContentType::Json. When replaying Y.Map commits with Text type, replay.rs returns "Text root not found" causing 500 errors.

Fix: Update src/api.rs (around lines 460-464) to use the node's actual content type when replaying commits.
design:
Fixed in 3 places:

1. api.rs get_node_head: Now gets content type from the node via DocumentNode downcast instead of hardcoding Text. This allows proper replay of JSON (Y.Map) commits.

2. api.rs replace_content: Now validates content type and returns 415 error for non-text nodes. Replace endpoint only supports text because it uses text-based diffing.

3. sync.rs push_schema_to_server: Simplified to always use edit endpoint with Y.Map updates. This avoids the replace endpoint's text-only limitation.
close_reason: Fixed server replay to use node's actual content type. GET /nodes/:id/head now works for JSON (Y.Map) documents. Replace endpoint properly rejects non-text content with 415. Merged in PR #7.

title: Handle rename events so new paths get sync tasks
description:
notify reports renames as `Modify(Name)` events; the current mapping treats all `is_modify()` as `DirEvent::Modified`. The modified handler only re-pushes schema and never starts new per-file sync tasks or removes old ones, so a rename leaves the new file untracked and the old path's tasks running until restart.

Consider handling rename explicitly (or treating `Modify(Name)` as delete+create).
design: Implemented by detecting `Modify(Name)` events separately from other modifications in the directory watcher. Rename events are now classified as delete+create based on RenameMode: From→Deleted, To→Created, Both/Any/Other→check path.exists() to determine direction. This ensures sync tasks are properly stopped for old paths and started for new paths.
close_reason: Rename events now handled properly - Modify(Name) events are classified as delete+create based on RenameMode. Merged in PR #5.

description: From PR #7 Codex review: When pushing schema updates, deletions are not being preserved. The code always posts an edit built by create_yjs_map_update but this may not handle entry deletions properly. Need to investigate and fix.
close_reason: Preserve schema deletions implemented. Added state field to HEAD response, client now applies server CRDT state before making changes so deletions create proper tombstones. Merged in PR #9.

title: Represent directory trees as Yjs JSON (Y.Map) instead of text JSON
description:
Currently, the fs-root document uses TEXT content type with JSON stored as a text string. This was a workaround because the edit system (diff.rs, replay.rs) uses TEXT-based Yjs updates (Y.Text), but DocumentNode for JSON type uses Y.Map internally.

The proper solution would be to use native Yjs JSON structure (Y.Map) for directory schemas, which would enable:
- Proper CRDT merging of concurrent schema changes
- More efficient updates (only changed entries, not full document replacement)
- Better conflict resolution for concurrent file additions/deletions
design:
Implemented Y.Map support:

1. replay.rs: Extended get_content_and_state_at_commit to support JSON content type by initializing Y.Map root and using map.to_json() for extraction.

2. sync.rs: Added create_yjs_map_update() and json_value_to_any() helper to convert JSON strings to Y.Map updates. Updated push_schema_to_server to use Y.Map updates for initial schema push.

This enables proper CRDT merging of concurrent schema changes and more efficient updates (only changed entries, not full document replacement).
close_reason: Added Y.Map support for directory schemas: replay.rs now supports JSON content type, sync.rs uses Y.Map updates for initial schema push. Merged in PR #6.

title: Enforce mandatory file extensions in filesystem sync
description: Update commonplace filesystem so that file extensions are mandatory. Only .json, .txt, .xml, .xhtml, and .bin files can be synced, and they must correspond to their Yjs implementations.
